Sentence.value: Hyperaldosteronism is a disorder in which the adrenal gland releases too much of the hormone aldosterone into the blood.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Hyperaldosteronism|C0020428]] is a [[disorder|C0012634]] in which the adrenal gland releases too much of the hormone aldosterone into the blood.

Sentence.value: Primary hyperaldosteronism is due to a problem of the adrenal glands themselves, which causes them to release too much aldosterone.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Primary hyperaldosteronism is due to a problem of the [[adrenal glands|C0001625]] themselves, which causes them to release too much [[aldosterone|C0002006]].

Sentence.value: In contrast, with secondary hyperaldosteronism, a problem elsewhere in the body causes the adrenal glands to release too much aldosterone.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: In contrast, with secondary hyperaldosteronism, a problem elsewhere in the body causes the [[adrenal glands|C0001625]] to release too much [[aldosterone|C0002006]].

Sentence.value: Most cases of primary hyperaldosteronism are caused by a noncancerous (benign) tumor of the adrenal gland.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Most cases of primary hyperaldosteronism are caused by a noncancerous ([[benign) tumor|C0086692]] of the [[adrenal gland|C0001625]].

Sentence.value: Primary and secondary hyperaldosteronism have common symptoms, including: - High blood pressure - High level of calcium in the blood - Fatigue - Headache - Muscle weakness - Numbness - Paralysis that comes and goes
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Primary and [[secondary hyperaldosteronism|C0271728]] have common symptoms, including: - High blood pressure - High level of calcium in the blood - Fatigue - Headache - Muscle weakness - Numbness - [[Paralysis|C0522224]] that comes and goes

Sentence.value: Tests that may be ordered to diagnose hyperaldosteronism include: - Abdominal CT scan - ECG - Plasma aldosterone level - Plasma renin activity - Serum potassium level - Urinary aldosterone A procedure to insert a catheter into the veins of the adrenal glands may need to be done.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Tests that may be ordered to diagnose hyperaldosteronism include: - Abdominal CT scan - ECG - Plasma aldosterone level - Plasma renin activity - Serum potassium level - Urinary aldosterone A procedure to insert a catheter into the [[veins|C0042449]] of the [[adrenal glands|C0001625]] may need to be done.

Sentence.value: Primary hyperaldosteronism caused by an adrenal gland tumor is usually treated with surgery.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Primary hyperaldosteronism|C1384514]] caused by an [[adrenal gland tumor|C0001624]] is usually treated with surgery.

Sentence.value: Even after surgery, some people still have high blood pressure and need to take medicine.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Even after surgery, some [[people|C0027361]] still have [[high blood pressure|C0020538]] and need to take medicine.

Sentence.value: Medicines to treat hyperaldosteronism include: - Drugs that block the action of aldosterone - Diuretics (water pills), which help manage fluid buildup in the body Secondary hyperaldosteronism is treated with medicines (as described above) and limiting salt intake.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Medicines|C0013227]] to treat [[hyperaldosteronism|C0020428]] include: - Drugs that block the action of aldosterone - [[Diuretics|C0012798]] (water pills), which help manage fluid buildup in the body [[Secondary hyperaldosteronism|C0271728]] is treated with medicines (as described above) and limiting salt intake.

Sentence.value: Primary hyperaldosteronism can cause very high blood pressure, which can damage many organs, including the eyes, kidneys, heart and brain.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Primary hyperaldosteronism|C1384514]] can cause very [[high blood pressure|C0020538]], which can damage many organs, including the eyes, kidneys, heart and brain.

Sentence.value: Impotence and gynecomastia (enlarged breasts in men) may occur with long-term use of medicines.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Impotence and [[gynecomastia|C0018418]] ([[enlarged breasts|C0020565]] in [[men|C0025266]]) may occur with long-term use of medicines.
